metadata.title: UILayoutGuide | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Apple Developer Documentation page for UILayoutGuide, a UIKit class that provides a rectangular area capable of interacting with Auto Layout. The document explains how layout guides replace placeholder views for defining spaces and encapsulating UI elements, includes code examples, and documents all properties, methods, and relationships of the class.

content.text: A rectangular area that can interact with Auto Layout.

Use layout guides to replace the placeholder views you may have created to represent interview spaces or encapsulation in your user interface. Traditionally, there were a number of Auto Layout techniques that required placeholder views. A placeholder view is an empty view that does not have any visual elements of its own and serves only to define a rectangular region in the view hierarchy. For example, if you wanted to use constraints to define the size or location of an empty space between views, you needed to use a placeholder view to represent that space. If you wanted to center a group of objects, you needed a placeholder view to contain those objects. Similarly, placeholder views could be used to contain and encapsulate part of your user interface. Placeholder views let you break up a large, complex user interface into self-contained, modular chunks. When used properly, they could greatly simplify your Auto Layout constraint logic.

There are a number of costs associated with adding placeholder views to your view hierarchy. First, there is the cost of creating and maintaining the view itself. Second, the placeholder view is a full member of the view hierarchy, which means that it adds overhead to every task the hierarchy performs. Worst of all, the invisible placeholder view can intercept messages that are intended for other views, causing problems that are very difficult to find.

The UILayoutGuide class is designed to perform all the tasks previously performed by placeholder views, but to do it in a safer, more efficient manner. Layout guides do not define a new view. They do not participate in the view hierarchy. Instead, they simply define a rectangular region in their owning view's coordinate system that can interact with Auto Layout.
To create a layout guide, you must perform the following steps:

items.text: Add the layout guide to a view by calling the view's addLayoutGuide(_:) method.
Define the position and size of the layout guide using Auto Layout.

content.text: You can use these guides to define the space between elements in your layout. The following example shows layout guides used to define an equal spacing between a series of views.

content.code:
let space1 = UILayoutGuide()
view.addLayoutGuide(space1)

let space2 = UILayoutGuide()
view.addLayoutGuide(space2)

space1.widthAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space2.widthAnchor).active = true
saveButton.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space1.leadingAnchor).active = true
cancelButton.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space1.trailingAnchor).active = true
cancelButton.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space2.leadingAnchor).active = true
clearButton.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space2.trailingAnchor).active = true
content.description: Creates two UILayoutGuide instances to define equal spacing between three buttons (saveButton, cancelButton, clearButton). The width anchors of both spaces are constrained to be equal, ensuring uniform spacing.

content.text: A layout guide can also act as an opaque box that contains other views and controls, letting you encapsulate parts of your view and break up your layout into modular chunks.

content.code:
let container = UILayoutGuide()
view.addLayoutGuide(container)

// Set interior constraints
label.lastBaselineAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(textField.lastBaselineAnchor).active = true
label.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.leadingAnchor).active = true
textField.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(label.trailingAnchor, constant: 8.0).active = true
textField.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.trailingAnchor).active = true
textField.topAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.topAnchor).active = true
textField.bottomAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.bottomAnchor).active = true

// Set exterior constraints
// The contents of the container can be treated as an opaque box
let margins = view.layoutMarginsGuide

container.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(margins.leadingAnchor).active = true
container.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(margins.trailingAnchor).active = true
container.topAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(topLayoutGuide.bottomAnchor, constant: 20.0).active = true
comments: // The contents of the container can be treated as an opaque box
content.description: Demonstrates using a UILayoutGuide as a container to encapsulate a label and text field. Interior constraints position elements within the container, while exterior constraints position the container relative to the view's margins and top layout guide.

paragraphs.text: Layout guides provides a lightweight method for encapsulating part of your layout. Note that this technique only affects how Auto Layout interacts with the encapsulated views. It does not change the view hierarchy in any way. However, this is not the only way to create modular user interfaces. Container views and container view controllers provide an even greater degree of encapsulation, letting you separate the layout, the view hierarchy and even the related view controller code. For more information, see Adaptivity and Size Changes in View Controller Programming Guide for iOS.

links.text: View Controller Programming Guide for iOS

paragraphs.text: Additionally, layout constraints do not fully encapsulate their contents. The system still compares the priority of optional constraints inside the layout guide with the priority of optional constraints outside the guide.

rows.description: A string used to identify the layout guide.
The layout guide's frame in its owning view's coordinate system.
The view that owns this layout guide.
A layout anchor representing the bottom edge of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the horizontal center of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the vertical center of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the height of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the leading edge of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the left edge of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the right edge of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the top edge of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the trailing edge of the layout guide's frame.
A layout anchor representing the width of the layout guide's frame.
The constraints that impact the layout of the guide.
A Boolean value indicating whether the constraints impacting the layout guide specify its location ambiguously.
A layout guide that tracks the keyboard's position in your app's layout.
A layout guide that represents the space the keyboard occupies in your app's layout.
A layout guide that automatically activates and deactivates layout constraints depending on its proximity to edges.
A factory class for creating size-based layout constraint objects using a fluent API.

pages.pageSummary: Complete Apple Developer Documentation page for UILayoutGuide class, explaining how layout guides replace placeholder views in Auto Layout, with code examples for equal spacing and encapsulation patterns, full API reference including properties for layout anchors and debugging, class relationships and conformances.

crossPageElements.runningFooters: Copyright (c) 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

sections.title: Class Header
sections.summary: Class declaration showing UILayoutGuide as a MainActor class with platform availability for iOS 9.0+, iPadOS 9.0+, Mac Catalyst 13.1+, tvOS 9.0+, and visionOS 1.0+.

sections.title: Overview
sections.summary: Explains the purpose of UILayoutGuide as a replacement for placeholder views in Auto Layout, describing the costs of placeholder views (overhead, message interception) and how layout guides provide a safer, more efficient alternative that doesn't participate in the view hierarchy.

sections.title: Creating Layout Guides
sections.summary: Step-by-step guide for creating layout guides (instantiate, add to view, define position/size with constraints) with two code examples: one for equal spacing between buttons and one for encapsulating a label-textfield pair as a modular chunk.

sections.title: Topics

subsections.title: Creating constraints using layout anchors
subsections.summary: Ten layout anchor properties: bottomAnchor, centerXAnchor, centerYAnchor, heightAnchor, leadingAnchor, leftAnchor, rightAnchor, topAnchor, trailingAnchor, widthAnchor

subsections.title: Debugging the layout guide
subsections.summary: One method (constraintsAffectingLayout) and one property (hasAmbiguousLayout) for debugging layout issues

subsections.title: Handling keyboard layout
subsections.summary: keyboardLayoutGuide property and related classes UIKeyboardLayoutGuide and UITrackingLayoutGuide for managing keyboard-aware layouts

sections.summary: Complete API reference organized into four categories covering basic properties, layout anchors, debugging tools, and keyboard handling.

sections.title: Relationships
sections.summary: Class inheritance (from NSObject), subclasses (UIFocusGuide, UITrackingLayoutGuide), and protocol conformances (CVarArg, Copyable, CustomDebugStringConvertible, CustomStringConvertible, Equatable, Hashable, NSCoding, NSObjectProtocol, Sendable, UIPopoverPresentationControllerSourceItem).

sections.title: See Also
sections.summary: Related class NSLayoutDimension for creating size-based layout constraints.

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows Apple's standard API reference structure: starting with class declaration and brief description, followed by conceptual overview explaining the problem (placeholder views) and solution (layout guides), then practical code examples, comprehensive API reference organized by category, and finally class relationships and related resources.

keyTerms.definition: A UIKit class that defines a rectangular area capable of interacting with Auto Layout without being a view in the hierarchy
An empty view with no visual elements used only to define rectangular regions for Auto Layout purposes
A property that represents an edge, center, or dimension of a layout guide's frame for creating constraints
Apple's constraint-based layout system for positioning and sizing views
The tree structure of UIView objects that defines the visual structure of an interface
Grouping related views together and treating them as a single unit for layout purposes
A layout anchor class for creating vertical position constraints
A layout anchor class for creating horizontal position constraints
A layout anchor class for creating size-based constraints (width/height)
A specialized layout guide that tracks the keyboard's position for keyboard-aware layouts
A layout guide that automatically activates/deactivates constraints based on proximity to edges
Swift concurrency attribute indicating the class must be used on the main thread

keyFindings: UILayoutGuide provides all functionality of placeholder views without view hierarchy overhead
Layout guides do not intercept touch events or participate in the responder chain
Three steps to create: instantiate, add to view via addLayoutGuide(_:), define constraints
Layout guides can create equal spacing between elements by constraining their widthAnchor properties
Layout guides enable modular UI by encapsulating groups of views as opaque boxes
Interior constraints position elements within the guide; exterior constraints position the guide itself
Available since iOS 9.0, indicating long-standing API stability
Supports debugging via constraintsAffectingLayout(for:) and hasAmbiguousLayout
UIKeyboardLayoutGuide extends functionality for keyboard-aware layouts
Conforms to Sendable, indicating thread-safety considerations in Swift concurrency

designDecisions.rationale: Avoids view hierarchy overhead, prevents message interception issues, improves performance

designDecisions.decision: Uses layout anchors for constraint creation
designDecisions.rationale: Provides type-safe, fluent API for creating constraints that matches UIView anchor API

designDecisions.decision: Inherits from NSObject rather than UIView
designDecisions.rationale: Emphasizes that layout guides are not views and shouldn't be treated as such

designDecisions.decision: Provides both leading/trailing and left/right anchors
designDecisions.rationale: Supports both LTR/RTL-aware layouts (leading/trailing) and fixed direction layouts (left/right)

codeExamples.title: Equal Spacing Between Views
codeExamples.code:
let space1 = UILayoutGuide()
view.addLayoutGuide(space1)

let space2 = UILayoutGuide()
view.addLayoutGuide(space2)

space1.widthAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space2.widthAnchor).active = true
saveButton.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space1.leadingAnchor).active = true
cancelButton.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space1.trailingAnchor).active = true
cancelButton.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space2.leadingAnchor).active = true
clearButton.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(space2.trailingAnchor).active = true
codeExamples.description: Creates two layout guides to define equal spacing between three buttons

codeExamples.title: Encapsulating Views as Modular Chunk
codeExamples.code:
let container = UILayoutGuide()
view.addLayoutGuide(container)

// Set interior constraints
label.lastBaselineAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(textField.lastBaselineAnchor).active = true
label.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.leadingAnchor).active = true
textField.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(label.trailingAnchor, constant: 8.0).active = true
textField.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.trailingAnchor).active = true
textField.topAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.topAnchor).active = true
textField.bottomAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(container.bottomAnchor).active = true

// Set exterior constraints
let margins = view.layoutMarginsGuide
container.leadingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(margins.leadingAnchor).active = true
container.trailingAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(margins.trailingAnchor).active = true
container.topAnchor.constraintEqualToAnchor(topLayoutGuide.bottomAnchor, constant: 20.0).active = true
codeExamples.description: Uses a layout guide as container to encapsulate label and text field, with interior and exterior constraints
